text: <@U0Z541B3P> another question, in ledger package, several places use 'int' and several place use 'uint64'. Should it be consistent? AFAIK, 'int' will have different bytes in different OS
if no effect, I can help do a patch

<@U12452RAP> - mostly the numbers are used as uint64 either because they represent block number (which is a unit64) or because underlying library requires a unit64 (e.g., proto buf's varint encoding).
Please feel free to fix if you find some place in the code where this can be simplified.
